com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.comb

Interface DirectedEdge

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ColorTag
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PolylineEdge, StraightLineEdge

    public interface DirectedEdge
extends ColorTag
    A DirectedEdge of a graph is a directed connection between 2 of its vertices.

    Objects that implement this interface must also override hashCode() and equals().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Color color()
      Returns the color of this object.
      Vertex from()
      Returns the source Vertex of this DirectedEdge.
      Polyline polyline()
      Returns the geometric representation of this DirectedEdge.
      Vertex to()
      Returns the destination Vertex of this DirectedEdge.

    • Method Detail

      • from

        Vertex from()
        Returns the source Vertex of this DirectedEdge. The source Vertex represents the beginning of a graph connection.
        Returns:
        the source Vertex of this DirectedEdge

      • to

        Vertex to()
        Returns the destination Vertex of this DirectedEdge. The destination Vertex represents the end of a graph connection.
        Returns:
        the destination Vertex of this DirectedEdge

      • color

        Color color()
        Returns the color of this object.

        The color of a DirectedEdge is the color of the line between from() and to().

        Specified by:
        color in interface ColorTag
        Returns:
        the color of this object

      • polyline

        Polyline polyline()
        Returns the geometric representation of this DirectedEdge.

        A geometric representation of a DirectedEdge is a straight line (or a curve approximated to line segments) bounded by from() and to().

        Returns:
        the geometric representation of this DirectedEdge
